flawed_nl_solution:
On the eastern part of the campsite, Mr Manuel counted 2*100 = <<2*100=200>>200 tents
The total number of tents in the eastern and the northern part of the campgrounds is 200+100 = <<200+100=3000>>3000
There are four times as many tents as the northernmost part in the central part of the campsite, which means there are 4*100 = <<4*100=400>>400 tents in the central part of the camp.
The total number of tents in the three parts of the campsite is 400+3000 = <<400+3000=3400>>3400
If you add the number of tents Mr. Manuel counted at the southern part of the campsite, you get 3400+200 = <<3400+200=3600>>3600 tents on the whole campsite
#### 3600

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 300, not 3000. It appears an extra zero was added to the number.
